title: 111_s1118
content: INCREASE IN AMOUNT OF DEPENDENCY AND INDEMNITY COMPENSATION PAYABLE TO SURVIVING SPOUSES. Increase in dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses under title 38, United States Code. The amendment increases the compensation rate to 55 percent of the monthly rate under section 1114(j). Additionally, it ensures that no reduction or offset in benefits will occur for individuals eligible for both dependency and indemnity compensation and benefits under another provision of law as a surviving spouse of a veteran. The amendments made by subsection (a) will apply to compensation paid under chapter 13 of title 38, United States Code, for months starting 180 days after the enactment of this Act. Phase-in of payment of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for veterans who die of non-service connected disability after receiving compensation for service-connected disability rated as totally disabling for at least five years. Section 1318 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to change the duration of total disability benefits for deceased veterans from 10 years to five years. Benefits will be payable at a rate of 50 percent if the disability was rated totally disabling for at least five years but less than six years before death. If a veteran's disability was continuously rated totally disabling for a period of at least six years but less than nine years before death, they may be eligible for benefits at a rate of 60%, 70%, or 80% of the benefits otherwise payable. If a veteran's disability was continuously rated totally disabling for a period of at least nine years before death, they may be eligible for benefits at a rate of 90% of the benefits otherwise payable. If the disability was rated as such for at least 10 years before death, they may be eligible for benefits at the rate otherwise payable. SEC. 3. Reducing the age limit for remarriage of surviving spouses to 55 for dependency and indemnity compensation. The age limit for remarriage of surviving spouses is reduced to 55 for dependency and indemnity compensation, with retroactive benefits prohibited before the effective date specified. Surviving spouses who remarried before age 55 can apply for benefits under title 38, United States Code, within one year of the enactment of this Act.
